io.github.ocelot.client

Class ScissorHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ocelot.client.ScissorHelper

  • public class ScissorHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    Handles scissoring parts of

    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    OpenGL Scissor Test Reference Page

    • Field Detail

      • framebufferHeight

        public static int framebufferHeight
        Specifies the height of the entire non-scaled FBO. This should only be used if rendering into a custom frame buffer and reset back to 0 when rendering with the minecraft frame buffer.

      • framebufferScale

        public static double framebufferScale
        Specifies the scale factor framebufferHeight is modified by. Usually GUI scale setting in Minecraft. This should only be used if rendering in a custom frame buffer. This should only be used if rendering in a custom frame buffer and reset back to 0 when rendering with the minecraft frame buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • enableScissor

        public static void enableScissor()
        Enables the scissor test. Make sure to call this before any push(float, float, float, float) calls are made.

      • disableScissor

        public static void disableScissor()
        Disables the scissor test. Make sure to call this after the last pop() calls is made.

      • push

        public static void push(float x,
                        float y,
                        float width,
                        float height)
        Pushes a new scissor test onto the stack. Can be reverted to the previous state by calling pop().
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the rectangle
        y - The y position of the rectangle
        width - The x size of the rectangle
        height - The y size of the rectangle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If width or height are negative

      • pop

        public static void pop()
        Removes the current scissor from the stack and reverts to the previous state specified.

      • getTop

        public static ScissorHelper.Entry getTop()
        Returns:
        The scissor entry currently being used
        Throws:
        java.util.EmptyStackException - If the stack is empty. Use isEmpty() to verify there is an entry in the stack

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        Whether or not there are any scissor entries in the stack
